metadata.title: YouTube Aspect Ratio Guide 2025: Optimal Sizes for All Formats
metadata.description: Complete guide to YouTube aspect ratios. Standard videos, Shorts, thumbnails, and channel art dimensions.

hero.headline: YouTube Aspect Ratio Guide
hero.subheadline: Optimal dimensions for every YouTube format. Standard videos, Shorts, and more.

sections.content: YouTube supports various aspect ratios, but optimal choices depend on your content type. Standard videos use 16:9 horizontal, Shorts use 9:16 vertical, and YouTube handles different ratios with letterboxing. Here's everything you need to know about sizing your content correctly.

content.title: 16:9 Standard
content.description: 1920x1080 or 3840x2160. The default for regular YouTube videos.

content.title: 1:1 Square
content.description: 1080x1080. Works but adds letterboxing on YouTube.

faq.question: What happens if I upload non-16:9 video?
faq.answer: YouTube adds letterboxing (black bars). Video still plays but looks unprofessional. Some ratios like 2:1 work for cinematic feel.

faq.question: Should I upload 4K?
faq.answer: If you have it, yes. YouTube compresses everything, but 4K gets higher bitrate allocation. Even 1080p viewers benefit from 4K upload.

faq.question: What frame rate should I use?
faq.answer: 24fps for cinematic, 30fps for talking head, 60fps for gaming/action. Match your source footage. Don't upscale frame rates.

faq.question: Can I upload square videos?
faq.answer: Yes, but they'll have black bars on sides. Better to crop to 16:9 for standard or 9:16 for Shorts. Square was for Facebook.
